properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Thunderstorms continue to move southeast across the area early this morning. Some of them may contain wind gusts to 60 km/h, heavy downpours giving 20 to 30 mm of rain an hour or less and frequent lightning. The thunderstorms are expected to move out by mid morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-05T15:59:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-05T08:59:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0649672388.2019
Area: Fraserdale - Pledger Lake, Kapuskasing - Hearst - Smooth Rock Falls
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: An intense low pressure system continues to give rain to Kivalliq this evening. The rain has mostly tapered off at Arviat and will end at Rankin Inlet and Baker Lake by Monday morning. Showers will persist off and on Monday and Monday night in all areas, however further amounts will be relatively light. Whale Cove and Rankin Inlet have had around 10 to 15 mm of rain since Saturday afternoon, with another 10 to 20 mm forecast for tonight and lesser amounts on Monday. Baker Lake has reported 25 to 30 mm of rain since Saturday morning. A further 5 to 10 mm is expected tonight with lesser amounts forecast for Monday. ### Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-05T15:59:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-05T01:39:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0637328041.2019
Area: Baker Lake, Rankin Region including Whale Cove
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of heat which is considered extreme in this region continues with maximum temperatures exceeding 28 degrees Celsius during the day and overnight minimums remaining at or above 13 degrees Celsius. Temperatures will begin to fall slightly starting Wednesday. ### Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. To get more information: - Check the local news for health and safety updates. - Check HealthLinkBC online resources about heat-related illness and how to protect yourself at www.healthlinkbc.ca/healthlinkbc-files/heat-related-illness. - Call HealthLinkBC at 8-1-1 to ask about heat-related illness. Environment Canada and local Medical Health Officers expect an increase in health and safety risks from heat and are advising the public to take precautions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-06T03:59:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-05T12:00:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0700404507.2019
Area: Central Coast - inland sections, North Coast - inland including Terrace, North Coast - inland including Kitimat
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A thermal ridge will remain over the B.C. interior for the next several days resulting in temperatures reaching 36 degrees Celsius combined with overnight lows near 18 degrees Celsius. This is the first heat event of the season. ### To get more information: - Check the local news for health and safety updates. - Check HealthLinkBC online resources about heat-related illness and how to protect yourself at www.healthlinkbc.ca/healthlinkbc-files/heat-related-illness. - Call HealthLinkBC at 8-1-1 to ask about heat-related illness. Environment Canada and local Medical Health Officers expect an increase in health and safety risks from heat and are advising the public to take precautions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-06T03:45:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-05T11:46:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4284913262.2019
Area: Fraser Canyon - north including Lillooet, Fraser Canyon - south including Lytton
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing large hail and heavy rain. ### Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-05T23:45:48-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-05T11:45:48-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2864555743.2019
Area: B.C. South Peace River, B.C. North Peace River
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing heavy rain. A line of thunderstorms capable of producing heavy rainfall rates is expected to approach the Avalon Peninsula this morning. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-08-05T16:59:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-05T06:27:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1595794296.2019
Area: Avalon Peninsula Southwest
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. Boaters may be surprised by strong gusts over bodies of water. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2019-08-06T03:13:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-08-05T15:14:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1955683707.2019
Area: Waskaganish
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Smoke is causing poor air quality and reducing visibility. Smoke is expected or occurring. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. If you, or someone in your care, develop symptoms, reduce strenuous outdoors activities where ever possible until the air quality improves. When outdoors, if your breathing becomes difficult or uncomfortable, stop or reduce strenuous physical activities. If you experience irritation of eyes, nose or throat, shortness of breath or other respiratory symptoms, you should take action to reduce your exposure to smoke. If you are feeling unwell and experiencing symptoms, contact your health care provider for advice. Issued jointly by Environment Canada and the Northwest Territories Departments of Environment and Natural Resources and Health and Social Services. For more information on air quality and your health, please visit the Northwest Territories Department of Health and Social Services at www.hss.gov.nt.ca/en/services/environmental-health/air-quality. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-08-06T02:26:38-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the Northwest Territories Departments of Environment and Natural Resources and Health and Social Services, 2019-08-05T10:26:38-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1123056859.2019
Area: Wrigley Region
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the Northwest Territories Departments of Environment and Natural Resources and Health and Social Services
